newsitem.title: USA: Inter-Regional's Dain unit sets record.
newsitem.headline: Inter-Regional's Dain unit sets record.

text.p: Inter-Regional Financial Group Inc said Tuesday its Dain Bosworth brokerage unit had record pre-tax earnings for 1996 of $64.6 million, up from $43.3 million a year ago.

Dain's revenues for the year rose to $408.8 million from $351.5 million. For the fourth quarter, Dain's earnings increased to $18.9 million from $13.9 million, and revenues rose to $107.6 million from $95.1 million.
Inter-Regional said its Rauscher Pierce Refsnes Inc unit earned $31.5 million in 1996, up from $18.0 million a year ago. Its revenues rose to $212.0 million from $187.5 million.
For the fourth quarter, Rauscher Pierce's earnings rose to $8.8 million from $5.3 million, and its revenues increased to $55.3 million from $53.7 million.
Earlier, Inter-Regional reported fourth quarter earnings of $1.21 a share, up from $0.86 a year ago. For the year, the company earned $4.46 a primary share, up from $2.86.

"In 1997, we expect continued strong performance from Dain Bosworth in the northwestern quadrant of the United States, and we expect to profitably capture more of the dynamic growth in the Southwest through Rauscher Pierce Refsnes," Irving Weiser, chairman of Inter-Regional, said in a statement.

Combined revenues in private client business topped $358 million in 1996, a record and an increase of 15 percent. In equity capital markets, revenues rose by 31 percent to a record $96.7 million. In fixed income, revenues declined eight percent to $82.3 million, although earnings were up.
The company did not provide earnings figures for these businesses.
